caption: Super draft selections 24 all house recipes Food delish Service quick and attentive
Service is outstanding, food is delicious and cost is totally reasonable.  I personally enjoy their Key Lime beer.

This was our second trip and won’t be returning, the service was unacceptable and the food mediocre. If their in the business to sell beer good luck! We had one drink a piece because our waitress never came back after taking the order!  It’s very unfortunate since we loved Big Blue the previous restaurant.
Good food and great wait staff
Will travel 1400miles to drink this beer! You moved and the new place is 👍
Great service,  beer is decent.
We are visiting the area. It was a lot of fun! The live music was great!
Food not so good
Great beers, great service, cool looking big space.
Very nice place! Loved the outdoor firepit on the front deck! Drink was very good.

Great bar food menu. IPA's were good and the one sour we had was great. Service was good and the place was clean and had a good vibe. We had our kids in tow and the kids menu was good with actual prepared meals for them not just a big upcharge on box mac which is always nice.

We stopped in for some appetizers and beer. I’m not a huge craft beer fan but the beer I had was very good. The appetizers were delicious! We had the pretzel, which was huge and so tasty with the dipping sauce, we also had the quesadillas, the margarita flatbread and the cauliflower bites. Everything was very tasty and very filling. We were extremely pleased and will definitely go back!
Big Storm was great.

Went there and was sat at the fireplace table without knowing it was a community table. Two people came and sat with us and put their feet up without masks around our food.  We requested they use masks and refused and started cursing at us...these people apparently knew the manager and got special treatment while we were asked to move to a separate table. Edit: Just a few things I want to add to clarify: (1) we did not know this was a communal seating area and would have never sat there if we were given a warning, (2) why should a communal table even be open during a pandemic? (3) if a "community" table is going to be open, shouldn't the people sitting there be respectful of others instead of refusing to take their feet off the table around food, cursing at us when we get more assertive, and laughing at our discontent?, and (4) we had to wait 20 extra minutes after requesting a manager to get any help

What a great lunch spot in downtown Cape Coral. Huge parking lot, good pub menu, and covid-19 prodicals in place. So much seating, inside and out that being socially distanced is not a problem. (Did I ment there's beer on tap?)

Went there last night to see the band and have dinner with friends.  Our waitress finally showed up after 15 minutes to take our drink order.  Fifteen minutes later our now warm beers arrived and she disappeared without asking if we wanted to order any food.  We flagged her down and my friends put in their order.  Apparently I was invisible to her as she never asked for my food order.  I walked over to the bar, found her and asked her to include a burger with our order... and she wrote it down and took off.  My 3 friends were served their dinners, ate their dinners and still no food for me! Just before I left I saw our waitress and complained that I never got my food to which she replied ... I can offer you a free beer.  Too little... too late.  The venue is great, music great, service not great! Won’t be rushing back.

I used to like this place but today was weird. They had no host or hostess just a sign to seat yourself.  The restaurant was super busy, I sat at a table for a few minutes before I gave up and left, because nobody came to take my order or get me a drink.  This was NOT the experience I have ever had here nor one that I want to have when I’m paying to go out and eat anywhere.
Great beer wait staff slow but still fantastic theo was very busy and curious.
Had open face caprese sandwich.  It was excellent.  Had Saison beer .wonderful

Horrible service today had to wait over 30 min for server named Julie who took our drinks then diaspeared for 40 min again.... had to find an employee to take order and when she came back she had a horrible attitude.  Been here before normally good service and food.

We came here expecting good service. The restaurant wasn’t busy but yet service was slow. Ordered the hot dog without pork and still got charged to add cheese and onions after the waitress said the pork could be substituted considering pork is more expensive than cheese and onion. The fries were soggy and the restaurant ran out of ketchup. We have had better experience in the past when it was still Big Storm. Must be under new management.

My friends and I love this place and the staff and sorry I’ve never reviewed. I happened to be tables away at the “feet on TABLE” incident. It was not a table. It was a fire pit that seats multiple parties.   Those kind of misleading reviews are so disappointing.  Sure, feet on a fire pit are DISGUSTING, but the demeanor of the guest and their loud tone, complaining about folks needing to wear masks to consume drinks in a public place ......in Florida (Lee County, at that) is a bit much. If sat at a communal seating area and they had issues with masks, then of course a manager would offer another table to them.
Great beer ,good food,cocktails&entertainment.

After being seated by hostess, a couple sat down at our table, no masks, feet up on the table. When we asked them to wear a mask they refused saying they are friends with the owner.  Manager offered to move us, not them.  Really? They should be avoided at all opportunities

There was a family sitting at a table with a fire. They had just been served their food when a rude couple sat down at the open side without masks and put their feet up on the table! The family tried unsuccessfully to get someone from the restaurant to ask the rude couple to wear a mask. None of the staff seemed to understand why this family didn't want to share a table with people who in her own words never wear masks. This was ridiculous. The food tasted delicious but the night was ruined because the staff had no regard for improving the situation. I would never return to this restaurant again
A place where the beer is delicious and the staff is better than anything else!

The beers are really good. However it seems to suffer from the same problem as the previous restaurant : inconsistent service.  A group of friends and I met there, enjoyed beers and had great service. The waitress let us know her shift was ending and we paid our tab. We were set to order dinner and more beers and we became invisible.  The table next to us had ad round of beers, ordered their food, got another round of beers, received their food.  The waitress kept walking by our table and even noticed our empty glasses.  After 45 minutes of being ignored we left. I was excited to try their hot chicken sandwich.  I guess we weren't worthy. Won't go back .

The environment is great the staff and food have a lot to be desired. I ordered the pico and chips the chip were blue cork and the pico was at best passable for what it’s called. I orders the red beer it was decent and tasted good. I had the Buffalo chicken sandwich and was highly disappointed in it, my wife had the Cuban pressed sandwich and we both found it to be the best thing we ordered by far. The fries we great once we added some salt. Kirsten our server was yer again just ok and for a slow Wednesday night I did expect better service.
Great outside dining!

Buffalo chicken sandwich,  fries, and wings were very good.  I was impressed with how crispy the chicken was with nice flavor.  Their red ale is quite tasty.  Overall, good service and food.  Will go back again

Love this place! Huge selection of delicious beers! I love sour beers and all 3 sours were amazing as well as the key lime beer! My husband loved the red ale. Lots of seating inside and outside with cozy heaters and fire tables on a cold night. We felt really safe even during covid. The food was delicious and our server Sam was super friendly and helpful. Highly recommend the grouper sandwiches!
It's open for business
Yep, was good. Food good.
Great service...great neighborhood bar !!!

I Miss Big Blue! I really wanted to love this place since I was a regular at Big Blue buuuut  the beer here is not good, very foamy and bloating, Service wasn't bad but the food wasn't all that great.

Second time here to eat... Had high hopes since the first time here was day 2 of their soft opening, and expected kinks. We were there 12/30/20 about 6:30pm 5 of us Inside empty, few at the bar, only people outside. So maybe half full. 10 minute wait for waitress to put drink and appetizer order in. 15 minute wait to get drinks 35 minute wait for food, never got app we ordered Missing items we ordered, no dressing on salads. Poor waitress apologizing for the kitchen and the bar. Got a lot of things to fix service wise. Might give it one more chance for dinner... Mac and cheese side is the bomb. Very disappointed...
Big storm brewery is a great addition to the downtown Cape. Mark our bartender is always fantastic, he gives us recommendations and samples of new beers 10/10 .
Great Christmas beer.
Very good food great service, awesome
Excellent food, brew & service!

Beer is good, as always, but the kitchen is very weak. Very limited menu, which is understandable, but not ideal. We ordered nachos with chorizo, and the smoked Mahi dip. The beer cheese on the nachos was fairly bland, and they had very little else in way of toppings. Literally maybe a tbsp of pico, with a dusting of chorizo, and about 5 slices of fresh jalapeno.  Literally worst nachos I've ever had, and I've ordered them at skating rinks lol. The Mahi dip was mostly mayo, and not great on flavor. It was served with 4 really nice crispy crackers, and oddly enough 4 stale saltine crackers...? Weird. Anyways, the food was not up to expectations of a craft brewery, and certainly not as good as Big Blue.  We'll give it another chance in maybe like 6 months, but there are much better places to eat and drink downtown Cape, so I recommend you patronize those places instead.
Good beer, good atmosphere.  Enough said.

Great job BSBC. I will miss Big Blue Brewing Co but was a fan of Big Storm prior, so I was excited to see them take over the reins after BBBC closed. Loved the beers I tried and the smoked mahi dip was excellent. Wish I had more room to try more beers and food but will definitely be back again to do so. Oh, and Sam was awesome as our server.

We always have a great time when visiting here. The beer and food are tasty but what really makes it special is the staff, especially the bartender Michelle. A few weeks ago my family and I were sitting outside and Michelle took care of my family’s very particular mixed drink needs, flawlessly going above and beyond, fielding their many questions with a smile. She definitely made the night more enjoyable than it already was. A+ service.
Good beer, great service! The hostesses are sweet and Michelle behind the bar is fabulous. First class hospitality all the way!
We absolutely love this place! Beer is amazing and the food is delicious. Mark the bartender is always fantastic and provides excellent service whenever we go in!

I was not too impressed with the old location.  The new location is awesome!  Food is decent, beer is great, and the best part is the staff.  Michelle is great and introduced us to other staff that were also awesome. Amy and Julie I think.  Keep rocking on and saving pups.  Great service makes the business.  I recommend the Oatmeal Stout and the amber Wave... beer.

The beer is 10/10, they brew a good variety. If you enjoy a juicy ale I would urge you to try their beermosa. That being said, their kitchen is weak. Big storm was better as a bar in my opinion. The food prices are quite high for the portions and quality. If your looking for a med-rare burger you will be sadly disappointed when you receive a well done burger without the slightest pink. I would recommend to the management to watch what your grill cooks are putting out and correct them as needed; if you're going to take temps on your meat, please honor those temps and not blatantly cook everything well dont.
Great brew .  Love this place👍👍👍 need to have comedy night!! lol Mark and Pat continue to be the best bartenders on the Cape . Ty ty
It has been a great night. Great food. Service  exceptional and staff very friendly

We had a great experience out at Big Storm Brewing Cape Coral.  The beer was excellent as was the food.  Most importantly the atmosphere and fun and welcoming.  Our bartender was Mark (the Australian guy) and he treated us like royalty.  He had great recommendations for food and knew which beers paired best with our meal.  We will be back many times and will always ask for Mark when we go!
Good beer, good service at the bar.

Kitchen is so very slow. Waited OVER 30 minutes for our food for a restaurant that was not even a quarter of the way full and the food wasn't that great. Needs better staff training or they won't make it through season.
( Cape Coral ) As a brewery good place to go but the food was a HUGE Disappointment  not one person in our party of six finished or enjoyed the meal 👎👎👎

Tried the chicken nachos, cuban sandwich and wings. Apparently the cuban was the best sandwich he ever had! I loved the wings, and the nachos were pretty good. I will probably try the pork nachos next time. They have a huge selection of their beer, but a limited food menu (which is understanding since they just moved locations and opened up within the last week!) We will definitely try it again, they also have a kids menu!
Love this place and can’t wait to see you and the amazing Big Blue crew in October!
The bartender was great! Very informative and entertaining. The beers were ice cold and delicious!
They were closing, but quite few options on tap...

Went around 3pm on Saturday (during the times of COVID) everything was clean, bartender was wearing mask.  There were few patrons, nice patio with covering, pool table, games, AIR CONDITIONING, and it's off the busy street so it's nice and quiet and dark.  We had two flights plus two and they were all delicious!  The standouts were new England IPA, Apricot, Pomegranate Sour, Black Currant sour, the key lime shandy, and the amber was a crowd pleaser.  We liked it so much we got a couple to go beers and a coffee.  We'll be returning for sure!!  The bartender was awesome as well.
Excellent choice of sour beers 🍻
Fan of all three locations, but stoked that Big Storm came to Cape Coral. Community minded, tasty beer, and fantastic crew.

I liked everything about this place! Cool little hang out with surprisingly excellent beers! Every beer I had I really enjoyed! The Bromosa, the Keylime Shandy, and their New England IPA were awesome! Took a bunch home with me! Thanks Big Storm! Cheers!!
Great beer selection and great people
Selling hand sanitizer for 70$ for a gallon during COVID.... 0 stars.

Big Storm took over the old Cape Coral Brewery location and if you've had Big Storm beers before you'll know there are plenty of styles to choose. It's a fun, clean place to hang out and beer tenders are super friendly. The brewer Kevin is crafting some super tasty beers. Very well managed and had an amazing craft beer festival this year. If you're in the area and you want great beer definitely stop it. They have car shows, live music, bar games and some decent local food trucks and there's also a pizza place next door.
The bald guy is very rude and charged us two beers when we had buy one get one on the ale trail. When I asked to cancel it he said he couldn’t and laughed at us. Never coming back!
Great beer, fantastic service (really amazing staff) and awesome atmosphere. Everyone should come here

Stopped in for a pint. Regular brewery vibe. The beer menu was a good variety. Had pretty much something for everyone. Even a couple sours. I tried the Cherry Watermelon cuz I need a low alcohol optIon. It want the best sour I’ve had as it las Jed some flavor depth but it was drinkable. Worth a stop if you’re a brewery crawler.
Always consistently good beer. Service is friendly and welcoming. One of our favorite places.
Cool place. Beer wasnt impressive and we tried 8 of the taps. Pretty pricey too. Nice guy behind the bar though. Wont be going back.
Solid beers, sounds like they have big growth plans. Good stuff for a solid brewery!

Great staff, friendly atmosphere you have to make this place a stop on your visit to the Cape. Oh and best of all the beer is fantastic their Bigwave is a super smooth beer and the Octoberfest is the best one I have ever had.
This place has great beers and amazing customer service Highly recommend for the beer lovers

Excellent beer selection, however the food menu is misleading.  They have several things listed as Vegan, however upon further investigation they are not vegan if the “Vegan Monster” patty is fried in the same oil as all their chicken wings, etc.  Basically the only vegan thing on their menu is a salad (of course b/c we Vegans ALWAYS want a salad).  If you want beer, I highly suggest the place, if you are a vegan and hungry, don’t order anything.
Tropic Pressure was my favorite!
Amazing beer and friendly staff. Try the tropic pressure!
Bartender was a cool dude and the dubbel and quad are excellent!
Great vibe, coffee for my grandson...I  tried the coffee....best cold brew ever!  The beer...excellent.  3 favs..tropic pressure...wavemaker... Kentucky  common
Great place. Great beers
Love all the lighter beer options
great casual hang out with games to play besides just eating and drinking yummy food and drinks. My favorite cider is the black widow. I highly recommend!

I love this bar because they have a lot of games!!! There’s board games.. Oversized jenga.. billiards.. darts.. the bar is very spacey with lots of tables and chairs. There’s also a comfy couch by the darts area. I don’t think they serve food but they offer free snacks. I love that they have one of my favorite ciders in a can.. The black widow cider. The servers are nice too. They also have trivia and other events each night. Sometimes a food truck parks outside. Nice place to hangout with friends , esp for the millennials
Beers ok. Merchandise was pathetic. T-shirt selection was Goodwill selection worthy. Very disappointing for a tourist or local fan.

Good local brewery. Larger selection of Porter/stout beers than I've seen at other places (all pretty good).    No food, but they occasionally have food trucks. Nice shaded out door area.  Great stop on an area brewery tour.
Nice beer selection at reasonable prices, plus it was open mic night and several of the people were very talented.

Really awesome space. The beers are solid with good variety. The taproom is clean and spacious with seating for probably 40 comfortably. Pool table, games, snacks, and TVs mean you don't just sit there drinking beer. I imagine their beers rotate often, but the Tropic Pressure ale and the Oats In Hose stout were both worth drinking. They also have trivia!
We were here when they had Open Mic on Wednesday, as well as BBQ.  Beer, food and musical talent were amazing.  Great atmosphere with very friendly staff and patrons.
Good brews!
Tasted several of they’re offerings.... Meteor Sour Berliner Weiss is true to style. Both sweet and sour,.. not overly carbonated. Well played !! Thanks Kacy !! Cheers 🍺🍺
Great place friendly bar staff and the ipas are good
Great brewery, great beers, very dog friendly!
Great beer!  Travis was an amazing host.  Highly recommend a stop here.  Tropic Pressure and the Cat 3 for the win!

This place has the potential to be a cool brewery tasting room. Nice building, really good beer, but the vibe is just off. It's like they don't care if any body comes in Needs better management to make it a place that locals want to frequent.
Good craft beers. Doesn't look open but it is!
Delicious beer, spotlessly clean taproom, and great merch selection! Can't wait to come back to see some music!
Satuday night trivia is GREAT!
Great place to hang out with friends.
Good beer nice atmosphere.
Sunday open mike is better than the drinks
Bartenders and brewer were great! The rest was boring. No food.
Great place great atmosphere awesome beer.
Great place for a good beer and chill
Great place to have a beer with friends and strangers.  Went for the meat raffle on Thursday and if you don't win the meat you stand a chance to win a free beer.
Excellent brews in a place that accommodates both socialites and introverts alike. I'll definitely be back for a growler or two of their Meteor Sour.
The beer and selection are great. Can't wait until they get a kitchen which they say is on the way. It will be a 5 star place then.

I was excited when I found a message on my phone from the manager Jordan, asking me to come in for an interview but I quickly realized how irresponsible they are at staying in contact with people they've interviewed for a job. I called them and was told "I'll have an answer tomorrow" so I would wait all the next day for them to call with no avail. I would call THEM them after a full day went by. Finally they asked for a  second interview with the regional manager. The questions from this interview were ridiculous... I understand an icebreaker questions but some of the questions I was asked were "chocolate or vanilla?" "If you could have any super power, what would it be" With very few real questions that I felt held any validity. Not to mention they conducted this interview in the middle of the lobby where any costomer could come in and distract or interrupt.(we were not interrupted but it was a very real possibility) They told me they wanted to speed the hiring process as fast as possible and I would be hearing from them very soon with an answer. Two full days go by and I didnt hear back. I decided to call the regional manager at the number he had on his buisness card. He did not answer, I left a message asking him to call me at his earliest convenience. I never heard back from this man, Travis, that interviewed me. The next day I called the shop I was directly attempting to apply at at, I was told to call back in 20 minutes when things calmed down as they were busy. I did, just to be told that they dont know and will have an answer for me the next day. I waited until about 8pm (the close at 9) to call them again with hopes of an answer, even a no would have been fine with me I just wanted real feedback. It rings, I hear them pick up and noise in the background then they hung up without a word. "That's strange" I think and call again. Same thing. I call for the 3rd and 4th time with the same problem. I think it's my phone and go to get my boyfriends phone to try again. FIVE TIMES IN A ROW THIS COMPANY HUNG UP ON ME WITHOUT A SINGLE WORD.  I have given up completely now, and shocker, still no call, that they promised me, letting me know whether I got the job or not.  Honestly I'm disappointed, I was looking forward to possibly  becoming a part of this team, over all the staff was friendly, aside from being hung up on, I didnt think they were rude, just unprofessional.

What an amazing brewery! Not only for the delicious beers but also the professionalism! Jordan, bar manager, helped us with a co-Ed baby shower at the brewery! It was a great success and everyone loved the party. Thanks Big Storm for making it possible to have the best baby brewing shower! We will definitely be back for other parties and Friday night drinks!
Great service, good selection of tasty beers!
Very cute local place. Jordan and Nick were awesome!!  Loved the corny jokes. 😉
This place is a hidden gem! It's spacious,  clean, and the beers are delicious ! The bartender. .though we didn't get his name...was personable and wonderful ! We will be back!
People are friendly and the beer is good. Nice look to the place. I would love to go again!

Recently made a visit to Big Storm, and I will be making a trip back! Many of the local breweries are either closed, or only open around 4pm on Mondays, but Big Storm opens at 2pm each Monday, which makes for a great stop after some lunch. We were served by Nick, and he seemed very knowledgeable and friendly. He was happy to offer information or suggestions for their brews, meanwhile keeping our glasses filled. The beer selection had a great variety of flavors! From super hoppy, malty varieties, to some lighter wheat based options. They even had a Gose, which not all breweries like to make! We really enjoyed our visit. Thanks Big Storm, and thank you, Nick!

Dropped by this brewery because it was one of the stops on the Southwest Florida Ale Trail. I am so glad that I did! The staff was extremely friendly and the beer was delicious! I was undecided on what to order, so the bartender gave me a sample of the Key Lime Shandy. It was so delicious that I had to order a glass of it. I can’t wait to go back to this brewery and try more of their variety of beers. An added bonus it that they have a pool table and darts.
